growing.water: Consistently moist; does not tolerate drought well, especially when fruiting
growing.soil: Rich, moisture-retentive, acidic soil (pH 4.5-5.5); amend with peat moss or pine needles if needed

planting.spacing: Highbush: 4-5 feet apart; Lowbush: 2-3 feet apart
planting.whenToPlant: Plant in early spring as soon as the soil can be worked
planting.propagation: Typically propagated by cuttings; layering or suckers can also be used (lowbush spreads by underground rhizomes)
planting.depth: Medium; plant at the same depth as in nursery pot or slightly deeper if bare-root
companion: Other blueberry varieties (cross-pollination improves yield and berry size)

pruning: Prune in late winter while dormant
No pruning during the first 2 years except to remove dead or weak growth
Remove flower buds the first 2 years to encourage strong vegetative growth
For highbush: remove oldest canes after year 5 to promote new growth
For lowbush: mow or cut plants to ground every 2-3 years after harvest to rejuvenate
careAndMaintenance.notes: Mulch with pine bark, sawdust, or wood chips to conserve moisture and maintain acidity

harvestingAndUsage.whenToHarvest: When berries are fully blue, plump, and easily detach from the plant, typically mid to late summer depending on variety
harvestingAndUsage.howToHarvest: Gently roll berries between fingers or palm; they should fall off easily when ripe
harvestingAndUsage.preservation: Freeze, dry, or make into jams and jellies; fresh berries can store in the fridge for up to 10 days

pollinators: Bumblebees and native solitary bees particularly effective
wildlifeResistance: Birds love blueberries â€” cover plants with netting during ripening to protect the crop

highbush.description: Common in home gardens; larger berries, upright shrubs 6-8 feet tall; best for zones 4-7; higher yields with cross-pollination

lowbush.description: Wild or semi-cultivated blueberries; smaller berries, dense ground cover 1-2 feet tall; very cold hardy (zones 3-6); good for naturalized plantings and erosion control
